title: الْجُمَلُ الَّتِي لَهَا مَحَلٌّ مِنَ الإِعْرَابِ
description: Learn about sentences that occupy grammatical positions (nominative, accusative, genitive) - complementing lesson 73 on sentences without position.

notes.title: Introduction: Sentences with Position
content: In Arabic grammar, some sentences occupy grammatical positions (لَهَا مَحَلٌّ مِنَ الإِعْرَاب) while others don't. A sentence has position when it can be replaced by a single word in the same slot.

There are seven types of sentences with grammatical position. This complements lesson 73 which covered the seven types of sentences WITHOUT grammatical position (الابتدائية، الاستئنافية، صلة الموصول، etc.).
keyPoints: Can be replaced by single word
Complements lesson on sentences without position

examples.arabic: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ (جملة الخبر)
examples.english: Zayd studies (predicate sentence - has position)

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُ الطَّالِبَ يَكْتُبُ (جملة الحال)
examples.english: I saw the student writing (circumstantial - has position)

examples.arabic: جَاءَ الَّذِي نَجَحَ (صلة الموصول)
examples.english: Who succeeded came (relative clause - NO position)

examples.arabic: قَالَ: أَنَا مُسَافِرٌ (الابتدائية)
examples.english: He said: I am traveling (opening - NO position)

notes.title: 1. Predicate Sentence (الجملة الخبرية)
content: A sentence that serves as خَبَر (predicate) for مُبْتَدَأ, or as خَبَر for إِنَّ/كَانَ and their sisters. It is فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ (nominative position) or نَصْبٍ (accusative) depending on the construction.
Example: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ - the sentence يَدْرُسُ is خَبَر in nominative position. Example: كَانَ زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ - يَدْرُسُ is خَبَر كَان in accusative position.
keyPoints: Can be verbal or nominal sentence

examples.arabic: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ: الجملة في محل رفع خبر
examples.english: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ: sentence in nominative as predicate

examples.arabic: إِنَّ زَيْدًا أَبُوهُ كَرِيمٌ: الجملة خبر إِنَّ
examples.english: إِنَّ زَيْدًا أَبُوهُ كَرِيمٌ: sentence is khabar of إِنَّ

examples.arabic: كَانَ زَيْدٌ يَعْمَلُ: الجملة في محل نصب خبر كان
examples.english: كَانَ زَيْدٌ يَعْمَلُ: sentence in accusative as khabar of كان

examples.arabic: الْعِلْمُ يَرْفَعُ صَاحِبَهُ
examples.english: Knowledge elevates its possessor (sentence as khabar)

notes.title: 2. Circumstantial Sentence (الجملة الحالية)
content: A sentence describing the state/condition of the subject or object at the time of the action. It is فِي مَحَلِّ نَصْبٍ (accusative position) because الحَال is always منصوب.
The حَال sentence must have a رَابِط (connector) linking it to صَاحِب الحَال - either a pronoun (ضمير) or وَاو الحَال. Example: جَاءَ زَيْدٌ يَضْحَكُ (he came laughing).

examples.arabic: جَاءَ زَيْدٌ يَضْحَكُ: الجملة في محل نصب حال
examples.english: Zayd came laughing: sentence in accusative as haal

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُهُ وَهُوَ يَبْكِي: جملة حالية مع واو الحال
examples.english: I saw him while he was crying: haal with واو

examples.arabic: لَا تَقْرَبُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَأَنْتُمْ سُكَارَى
examples.english: Do not approach prayer while intoxicated (Quran)

examples.arabic: خَرَجَ الطُّلَّابُ يَتَحَدَّثُونَ
examples.english: The students went out talking

notes.title: 3. Adjectival Sentence (الجملة النعتية)
content: A sentence that describes an indefinite noun (نَكِرَة). It follows the described noun's case: رَفْع, نَصْب, or جَرّ. Only indefinite nouns can have sentence-adjectives.
Example: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا (A man carrying a book came). The sentence يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا describes رَجُلٌ and is in محل رفع because رَجُلٌ is مرفوع.

examples.arabic: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا: الجملة في محل رفع نعت
examples.english: A man carrying a book came: sentence in nominative as adjective

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُ طَالِبًا يَقْرَأُ: الجملة في محل نصب نعت
examples.english: I saw a student reading: sentence in accusative as adjective

examples.arabic: مَرَرْتُ بِرَجُلٍ يَبِيعُ الْكُتُبَ: في محل جر
examples.english: I passed by a man selling books: in genitive position

examples.arabic: هَذَا كِتَابٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ مُبَارَكٌ (الأنعام: ٩٢)
examples.english: This is a book We sent down, blessed (Quran)

notes.title: 4. Object Sentence (الجملة المفعولية)
content: A sentence serving as the object of a verb, especially with قَالَ (said), ظَنَّ (thought), and similar verbs. It is فِي مَحَلِّ نَصْبٍ (accusative position).
Example: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللهِ (He said: I am Allah's servant). The sentence إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللهِ is مَفْعُول بِهِ (object) of قَالَ. This is called مَقُول الْقَوْل.
keyPoints: Object of verbs like قَالَ، ظَنَّ

examples.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللهِ: الجملة في محل نصب مفعول به
examples.english: He said: I am Allah's servant: sentence as object

examples.arabic: ظَنَنْتُ زَيْدًا يَنْجَحُ: الجملة مفعول به ثان
examples.english: I thought Zayd would succeed: sentence as second object

examples.arabic: عَلِمْتُ أَنَّ الْعِلْمَ نَافِعٌ
examples.english: I knew that knowledge is beneficial

examples.arabic: قَالُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا
examples.english: They said: We hear and obey

notes.title: 5. Genitive Sentence (الجملة المضاف إليها)
content: A sentence following ظُرُوف (adverbs) or certain nouns in إِضَافَة. It is فِي مَحَلِّ جَرٍّ (genitive position). Common with: حِينَ، إِذْ، إِذَا، حَيْثُ, etc.
Example: جِئْتُ حِينَ طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ (I came when the sun rose). The sentence طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ is مُضَاف إِلَيْه in genitive position.
keyPoints: After ظروف: حِينَ، إِذْ، إِذَا، حَيْثُ

examples.arabic: جِئْتُ حِينَ طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ: الجملة في محل جر
examples.english: I came when the sun rose: sentence in genitive

examples.arabic: اذْكُرْ إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ: الجملة مضاف إليه
examples.english: Remember when your Lord said: sentence as مضاف إليه

examples.arabic: اجْلِسْ حَيْثُ يَجْلِسُ الْعُلَمَاءُ
examples.english: Sit where the scholars sit

examples.arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ النَّاسُ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
examples.english: The Day people stand before Lord of the worlds (Quran)

notes.title: 6-7. Conditional Answer and Following Conjunction
content: 6) جُمْلَة جَوَاب الشَّرْط الْجَازِم الْمَقْرُونَة بِالْفَاء: When the conditional answer has فَاء, it's في محل جزم. Example: إِنْ تَدْرُسْ فَأَنْتَ نَاجِحٌ - فَأَنْتَ نَاجِحٌ is in jussive position.

7) الْجُمْلَة الْمَعْطُوفَة عَلَى جُمْلَة لَهَا مَحَلّ: A sentence conjoined to another that has position shares that position. Example: زَيْدٌ يَأْكُلُ وَيَشْرَبُ - both have nominative position as khabar.
keyPoints: جواب الشرط with فَاء: في محل جزم

examples.arabic: إِنْ تَدْرُسْ فَأَنْتَ نَاجِحٌ: الجملة في محل جزم
examples.english: If you study, you will succeed: sentence in jussive position

examples.arabic: مَنْ يَعْمَلْ سُوءًا فَلَهُ جَزَاؤُهُ: جملة جواب الشرط
examples.english: Who does evil, for him is its recompense (conditional answer)

examples.arabic: زَيْدٌ يَأْكُلُ وَيَشْرَبُ: يشرب معطوفة في محل رفع
examples.english: Zayd eats and drinks: يشرب conjoined, in nominative

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُ طَالِبًا يَقْرَأُ وَيَكْتُبُ: كلاهما في محل نصب
examples.english: I saw a student reading and writing: both in accusative

exercises.prompt: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ - جُمْلَةُ 'يَدْرُسُ' فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ _____
exercises.promptEn: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ - the sentence 'يَدْرُسُ' is in nominative position as _____

exercises.prompt: جَاءَ زَيْدٌ يَضْحَكُ - جُمْلَةُ 'يَضْحَكُ' فِي مَحَلِّ نَصْبٍ _____
exercises.promptEn: جَاءَ زَيْدٌ يَضْحَكُ - the sentence 'يَضْحَكُ' is in accusative position as _____

exercises.prompt: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا - الْجُمْلَةُ فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ _____ لِـ'رَجُل'
exercises.promptEn: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا - the sentence is in nominative as _____ for 'رَجُل'

exercises.prompt: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللهِ - الْجُمْلَةُ فِي مَحَلِّ نَصْبٍ _____ بِهِ
exercises.promptEn: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللهِ - the sentence is in accusative as _____ (object)

exercises.prompt: جِئْتُ حِينَ طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ - الْجُمْلَةُ فِي مَحَلِّ جَرٍّ _____ إِلَيْهِ
exercises.promptEn: جِئْتُ حِينَ طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ - the sentence is in genitive as _____
The adjectival sentence describes only _____ nouns (definite/indefinite)

exercises.prompt: الْجُمْلَةُ الَّتِي لَهَا مَحَلٌّ مِنَ الإِعْرَابِ
exercises.answer: A sentence that has grammatical position (can be replaced by a single word)
The circumstantial sentence (describes state, in accusative position)
The quoted speech (sentence as object of قَالَ)

exercises.prompt: A sentence serving as the predicate (خَبَر) of a subject
A sentence describing an indefinite noun (as adjective)
The position of a sentence after adverbs like حِينَ، إِذْ، حَيْثُ
